dct_title_s: Claudii Ptolemaei Alexandrini mathematicor principis, opus Geographiae
dct_description_sm: Woodcuts based on those by Martin Waldseemüller, 1470-1519.
First 4 and last 4 pages blank (included in page description).
Some pages have a fol. number in decorative banner at top.
Engraved title page, printed in black and red.
Diagrams and tables with explanatory text on leaves of plates s-siiii, [1]-[4].
Descriptive text on versos of maps.
Abridged map titles in ornamental banners above maps; full titles on versos (differences indicated in square brackets following recto map titles below).
Map 1 shows zodiac, many show ports (e.g. Map 40); Maps 28 and 29 show world; Map 29 has rhumb lines; Map 46 shows climate. oddly shaped maps, including trapezoids (e.g. Map 46).
Some oddly shaped maps, including trapezoids (e.g. Map 46).
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
